title: Exactly what is required to boot and run Seven from USB

forumNotes.author: was_The Magizian
forumNotes.content:
Topic was locked so I'll reply via post...  

Yeah, actually I would be more interested in your work with MS win Seven... Wasn't able to make a functional vistaPE or SevenPE using winbuilder (Still working on my own version of a hyperaccelerated 7600 for USBdisk)... I might not be releasing mine publicly..   

If you go bart's route (setup to 32bit shell) then you would only need to give the usbdisk an nt60 bootsector... To boot any version of full blown seven from a USBdisk you will need: an nt60 bootsector, a HDFS\~NTFS filesystem (a usbdisk is udf/cdfs), a Atapi mode PCI\~ACHI over USB workaround, and alteration of one line of code in the setup.exe file.  

Until I release my version of Seven for usbdisk, I would suggest using **SOME WAREZ** to keep from getting all your code stolen and reverse engineered before public release.  

The Magizian

Regards,  
Galapo.
